definition: value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: Someone is on duty here around-the-clock .
Who came to the guards' room today?
sentences.chinese: 今天都有誰來值班室了？

sentences.english: There were only two tills open, while six others stood unattended.
sentences.chinese: 只有兩個收銀處開着，其他六個都空着沒人值班。

sentences.english: A: I report to the Shift Supervisor, and he reports to the Factory Manager.
sentences.chinese: 我向值班主任報告，他向廠長報告。

sentences.english: I report to the Shift Supervisor, and he reports to the Factory Manager.
sentences.chinese: 我向值班主任報告，他向廠長報告。

sentences.english: General administration of Property Operation Maintenance during duty together with management of the Engineering Department.
sentences.chinese: 在值班期間管理酒店運行維修部。

sentences.english: Infm the Front Office Manger Manger on Duty Security immediately of lost items.
sentences.chinese: 遺失物品通知前廳經理或值班經理和保安部。

sentences.english: My son was looking after me tonight, and she slept quietly on the camp-bed close to a wall.
sentences.chinese: 這一夜我兒子值班，他靜靜地睡在靠牆放的帆布牀上。

sentences.english: PSCO: Excuse me, are you the sailor on duty?
sentences.chinese: 對不起，你上值班水手嗎？

sentences.english: Residents and interns are often rotated between different nurse stations.
sentences.chinese: 住院醫師及實習醫師常花許多時間在排值班。

sentences.english: Objective To explore the effect of changed ways of second line nurses "on-duty" in pediatric ward.
sentences.chinese: 目的探討改變兒科二線護士值班方式的效果。

sentences.english: In security wei on duty room registration.
Now, today's shift will be the eighth straight full-deployment shift in DC.
sentences.chinese: 現在，今天的值班將是特區連續第八天的全勤值班。

sentences.english: Now, today's shift will be the eighth straight full-deployment shift in DC.
sentences.chinese: 現在，今天的值班將是特區連續第八天的全勤值班。

sentences.english: During the day, too, occupants rotate house-sitting duties.
sentences.chinese: 而白天，他們也輪流值班守護。

sentences.english: The police on duty tried to shoo away the crowd by using a loud-speaker.
sentences.chinese: 在值班的警員試着把人羣散去，於是他使用了揚聲器。

definition: variant of 執勤|执勤[zhi2 qin2]
to change shift/the next work shift/to relieve (a workman on the previous shift)/to take over the job
(of a security guard etc) to be on duty, keeping an eye on things/to keep watch
to be on duty (of a security guard etc)
to act as substitute/to fill in for sb
to shift holidays, taking a weekday off
to go to work/to be present (at work, school etc)/to be away on business
to take time off/to take leave (e.g. for study)/to skive off work
